items.question: How does OpenObserve collect AWS logs and metrics?
items.answer:
OpenObserve offers multiple ingestion methods:
  • Kinesis Data Firehose for log delivery from various AWS services
  • Direct CloudWatch integration for metrics
  • AWS Lambda function logs through Kinesis Firehose
  • Custom metrics via API endpoints
  • All AWS services can send their logs via S3 to Openobserve
  • Refer to our detailed setup guides here

items.question: What's the typical setup process for AWS monitoring?
items.answer:
The setup process varies by data source. For example, you may implement the following at a high level:

Via Kinesis Data Firehose:
  1. Create a Firehose delivery stream
  2. Configure source AWS service to send logs to Firehose
  3. Set up IAM roles and permissions
  4. Configure OpenObserve endpoint in Firehose


For CloudWatch Metrics:
  1. Configure CloudWatch integration
  2. Set up necessary IAM permissions
  3. Select metrics to collect
  4. Configure collection frequency
  5. Refer to our detailed setup guides here

items.question: How does OpenObserve collect GCP data?
items.answer:
OpenObserve offers two primary collection methods:
  1. Cloud Logging export to Pub/Sub: Collect logs from GCP services by creating a sink in Cloud Logging that exports to a Pub/Sub topic. This method supports all standard GCP log types, including audit logs, VPC flow logs, and application logs.
  2. OpenTelemetry collector: Deploy the collector via Terraform to gather metrics and traces. The collector can be configured to collect both platform metrics and custom application metrics.

items.question: Which GCP services can I monitor?
items.answer:
OpenObserve supports monitoring for core GCP services including but not limited to:
  • Compute Engine: VM instance metrics, system logs, and application logs
  • Cloud Run: Request logs, container metrics, and deployment events
  • Cloud Functions: Execution logs, performance metrics, and invocation data
  • Cloud SQL: Database metrics, error logs, and query insights
  • Load Balancer: Request logs, latency metrics, and traffic distribution
  • VPC Flow Logs: Network traffic analysis and security monitoring
  • Cloud Audit Logs: Track administrative activities and data access

items.question: What's the setup process for GCP monitoring?
items.answer:
For Cloud Logging export:
  1. Create a Cloud Logging sink to define which logs to export
  2. Configure Pub/Sub export with appropriate IAM permissions
  3. Set up OpenObserve integration with your Pub/Sub subscription
  4. Verify data flow and configure log parsing rules

For OpenTelemetry:

  1. Deploy collector using Terraform with provided configuration templates
  2. Configure authentication using service accounts
  3. Enable metric collection for desired services
  4. Set up metric filters and aggregation rules

items.question: How are GCP logs processed?
items.answer:
OpenObserve processes logs with:
  • Built-in log parsing for standard GCP log formats
  • SQL-based querying for complex log analysis
  • Structured data support for JSON and other formats
  • Timestamp processing with timezone handling
  • Field extraction and indexing for efficient searches
  • Automatic metadata enrichment

items.question: What analysis capabilities are available?
items.answer:
OpenObserve provides:
  • SQL query support with aggregations and joins
  • Time-series analysis with customizable time windows
  • Log search and filtering with full-text capabilities
  • Metric aggregations with statistical functions
  • Custom dashboards for visualization
  • Alert configuration based on queries

items.question: What is Kubernetes monitoring?
items.answer: Kubernetes monitoring refers to the process of tracking and analyzing the performance, health, and security of Kubernetes clusters, nodes, pods, and containers. It involves collecting and analyzing metrics, logs, events and traces to identify issues, optimize resource utilization, and ensure the reliability and scalability of Kubernetes environments.

items.question: How does OpenObserve simplify Kubernetes observability?
items.answer:
OpenObserve simplifies Kubernetes observability by providing a unified platform for monitoring and troubleshooting Kubernetes applications. With OpenObserve, you can:

  • Collect metrics, logs, and traces from your Kubernetes cluster with minimal configuration and overhead.
  • Visualize performance and health metrics in real-time through customizable dashboards.
  • Receive proactive alerts and notifications for potential issues and security threats.
  • Analyze and troubleshoot issues with ease using our intuitive and scalable platform.

items.question: What are the key features of the OpenObserve Collector?
items.answer:
The OpenObserve Collector is a preconfigured OpenTelemetry (OTel) Collector that follows best practices to capture all signals from your Kubernetes environment. The key features include:

  • Metrics Collection: Gather metrics from your Kubernetes cluster, including CPU, memory, and disk usage.
  • Event Gathering: Capture events occurring within the cluster, facilitating real-time monitoring and alerting. e.g. which pods got evicted.
  • Log Aggregation: Collect logs from all pods, aiding troubleshooting and analysis.
  • Automatic Trace Capture: Enable tracing without requiring manual instrumentation of applications, using OpenTelemetry's auto-instrumentation capabilities.
